Method Detail

startReceiving

protected void startReceiving()
Listens for and handles all incoming packets

sendPacket

public void sendPacket(int packetId,
                       java.lang.Object... data)
Sends a packet with the specified id and payload

An example usage of this method might look like this: 


 sendPacket(77, player.getName(), player.getIP());
 // Or
 sendPacket(15, player.getName(), player.getSkillLevel(0), player.getSkillLevel(1), player.getSkillLevel(2));
Alternatively, GhostPacket can be extended to make this process easier.

Parameters:
packetId - the id of the packet to send
data - the data (in correct order, separated by commas) to send

setPassword

protected void setPassword(java.lang.String newPass)
Notifies the Connection that the specified password must be received in order for the session to continue.

Parameters:
newPass - the password that must be matched

terminationRequested

public void terminationRequested(java.lang.String reason)
Called then the session must be terminated.

Specified by:
terminationRequested in interface SessionManager
Parameters:
reason - the reason the session was terminated
